name: elfzelzd
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wcel(c0, cz))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cz))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wcel(c0, cz))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cfz, c2)), wcel(c0, cz))

comment: A member of a finite set of sequential integer is an integer. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
